text: Rossana Rossanda (23 April 1924 â€“ 20 September 2020) was an Italian left-wing politician, journalist, and feminist. She was born in Pula, then-Kingdom of Italy. She was a member of the Italian Communist Party and Proletarian Unity Party Between 1963 and 1968, she was a member of the Chamber of Deputies. In 1969, she founded the newspaper Il manifesto. Rossanda died on 20 September 2020 in Rome at the age of 96. ==References== Category:1924 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Italian politicians Category:Italian journalists Category:Feminist writers Category:Italian communists Category:People from Pula
title: Rossana Rossanda
